title: Universal Instructional Design-Based Social Integration Education Program for Remote Migrants

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and Korean language proficiency at native-speaker level
context.additional_context: Universal design applied for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields who are immigrants, considering cultural differences and language barriers.

learning_goals: Learners can apply universal instructional design principles reflecting cultural differences by 80% or more when designing educational programs for immigrants.
Learners can propose three or more effective blended learning strategies for operating BYOD environments aimed at bridging the digital divide.
Learners can develop educational materials supporting immigrants' social integration through project-based assessments and receive peer evaluations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
